roleset.name: hold back, set aside
roleset.note: RESERVE-V NOTES: I read the ArgM as modifying either "its rights" or the arg0 "it".Either way, it's not attached to the reserving. Not sure about that, after all. Hopefully a better example will comeup. (from reserve.01-v)
RESERVATION-N NOTES: Based on verb entry reserve.01; corresponds to Verbnet class get-13.5.1. (from reservation.01-n)
RESERVED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on reserve-v.01, WordNet. Corresponds to VNcls get-13.5.1. (from reserved.01-j)

roles.note: No examples of attribute found with noun thus far. See verb entry for examples. , (from reservation.01-n)

example.name: reserve-v: just transitive
example.text: Mr. Alito said his office ``just responded to an attorney's question about whether we would go after attorney's fees, and that is different from actually doing it, although we reserve that right.''

example.name: reserve-v: with benefactive
example.text: That's why Columbia just wrote off $130 million of its junk and reserved $227 million for future junk losses.

example.name: reserve-v: attributive, but not arg3
example.text: Gemina said in a statement that ``it reserves the right to take any action to protect its rights as a member of the syndicate.''
example.arg: the right to take any action to protect its rights
as a member of the syndicate

example.name: reserve-v: with arg3
example.text: John reserved a table at McDonald's for Mary as part of their anniversary celebration.
example.arg: as part of their anniversary celebration.

example.name: make_reservation-l: Within LVC, args 0 & 1
example.text: In one phone call , ski buffs can make hotel and restaurant reservations , buy lift tickets , rent ski equipment and sign up for lessons .

example.name: reservation-n: with benefactive
example.text: He made hotel reservations for them.

example.name: reserved-j: A rule to live by
example.text: This seat is reserved for someone in a really good mood.
example.arg: for someone in a really good mood

roleset.name: reticent, stoic, using self-restraint
roleset.note: RESERVED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, WordNet. (from reserved.02-j)

example.name: reserved-j: arg1
example.text: Nice to see that those lacking a religion are now a majority , although thankfully [UK Christians]-1 tend *PRO*-1 to be very reserved and moderate unlike their US counterparts .

example.name: have_reservations-l
example.text: I have reservations about going out in the bad weather.
example.arg: about going out in the bad weather
